enumeration.name: pulumi.experimental.providers.log_severity
enumeration.description: The severity level of a log message. Errors are fatal; all others are informational.

values.name: debug
values.description: A debug-level message not displayed to end-users (the default).

values.name: info
values.description: An informational message printed to output during resource operations.

values.name: warning
values.description: A warning to indicate that something went wrong.

values.name: error
values.description: A fatal error indicating that the tool should stop processing subsequent resource operations.

record.name: pulumi.experimental.providers.log_message
record.description: A log message to be sent to the Pulumi engine.

properties.name: severity
properties.description: The logging level of this message.

properties.name: message
properties.description: The contents of the logged message.

properties.name: URN
properties.description: The (optional) resource urn this log is associated with.

properties.name: stream_id
properties.description: The (optional) stream id that a stream of log messages can be associated with. This allows clients to not have to buffer a large set of log messages that they all want to be conceptually connected.  Instead the messages can be sent as chunks (with the same stream id) and the end display can show the messages as they arrive, while still stitching them together into one total log message. 0 means do not associate with any stream.

properties.name: ephemeral
properties.description: Optional value indicating whether this is a status message.

interface.name: pulumi.experimental.providers.host
interface.description: An interface to the engine host running this plugin.

methods.name: log
methods.description: Send a log message to the host.

record.name: pulumi.experimental.providers.check_request
record.description: A request to validate the inputs for a resource.

properties.name: URN
properties.description: The Pulumi URN for this resource.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The Pulumi type for this resource.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The Pulumi name for this resource.

properties.name: olds
properties.description: The old Pulumi inputs for this resource, if any.

properties.name: news
properties.description: The new Pulumi inputs for this resource.

properties.name: random_seed
properties.description: A deterministically random hash, primarily intended for global unique naming.

record.name: pulumi.experimental.providers.check_failure
record.description: Indicates that a call to check failed; it contains the property and reason for the failure.

properties.name: property
properties.description: The property that failed validation.

properties.name: reason
properties.description: The reason that the property failed validation.

record.name: pulumi.experimental.providers.check_response
record.description: The response from checking a resource.

properties.name: inputs
properties.description: The provider inputs for this resource.

properties.name: failures
properties.description: Any validation failures that occurred.

record.name: pulumi.experimental.providers.diff_request
record.description: A request to diff the inputs for a resource.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the resource to diff.

properties.name: URN
properties.description: The Pulumi URN for this resource.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The Pulumi type for this resource.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The Pulumi name for this resource.

properties.name: olds
properties.description: The old values of provider inputs to diff.

properties.name: news
properties.description: The new values of provider inputs to diff.

properties.name: ignore_changes
properties.description: A set of property paths that should be treated as unchanged.

record.name: pulumi.experimental.providers.diff_response
record.description: The response from diffing a resource.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the resource to diff.

record.name: pulumi.experimental.providers.configure_request
record.description: A request to configure a provider.

record.name: pulumi.experimental.providers.create_request
record.description: A request to create a resource.

properties.name: URN
properties.description: The Pulumi URN for this resource.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The Pulumi type for this resource.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The Pulumi name for this resource.

properties.name: properties
properties.description: The provider inputs to set during creation.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: The create request timeout.

properties.name: preview
properties.description: true if this is a preview and the provider should not actually create the resource.

record.name: pulumi.experimental.providers.create_response
record.description: The response from creating a resource.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the created resource.

properties.name: properties
properties.description: Any any properties that were computed during creation.

record.name: pulumi.experimental.providers.read_request
record.description: A request to read a resource.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the resource to read.

properties.name: URN
properties.description: The Pulumi URN for this resource.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The Pulumi type for this resource.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The Pulumi name for this resource.

properties.name: properties
properties.description: The current state (sufficiently complete to identify the resource).

properties.name: inputs
properties.description: The current inputs, if any (only populated during refresh).

record.name: pulumi.experimental.providers.read_response
record.description: The response from reading a resource.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the resource read back (or empty if missing).

properties.name: properties
properties.description: The state of the resource read from the live environment.

properties.name: inputs
properties.description: The inputs for this resource that would be returned from Check.

record.name: pulumi.experimental.providers.update_request
record.description: A request to update a resource.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the resource to update.

properties.name: URN
properties.description: The Pulumi URN for this resource.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The Pulumi type for this resource.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The Pulumi name for this resource.

properties.name: old
properties.description: The old values of provider inputs for the resource to update.

properties.name: new
properties.description: The new values of provider inputs for the resource to update.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: The create request timeout.

properties.name: ignore_changes
properties.description: A set of property paths that should be treated as unchanged.

properties.name: preview
properties.description: true if this is a preview and the provider should not actually update the resource.

properties.name: properties
properties.description: Any properties that were computed during updating.

record.name: pulumi.experimental.providers.delete_request
record.description: A request to delete a resource.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The ID of the resource to delete.

properties.name: URN
properties.description: The Pulumi URN for this resource.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The Pulumi type for this resource.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The Pulumi name for this resource.

interface.name: pulumi.experimental.providers.provider
interface.description:
Provider presents a simple interface for orchestrating resource create, read, update, and delete operations. Each provider understands how to handle all of the resource types within a single package.

It is important to note that provider operations are not transactional (Some providers might decide to offer transactional semantics, but such a provider is a rare treat). As a result, failures in the operations below can range from benign to catastrophic (possibly leaving behind a corrupt resource). It is up to the provider to make a best effort to ensure catastrophes do not occur. The errors returned from mutating operations indicate both the underlying error condition in addition to a bit indicating whether the operation was successfully rolled back.

methods.name: check_config
methods.description: Validates the configuration for this resource provider.

methods.name: diff_config
methods.description: Checks what impacts a hypothetical change to this provider's configuration will have on the provider.

methods.name: configure
methods.description: Configures the resource provider with "globals" that control its behavior.

methods.name: check
methods.description: Validates that the given property bag is valid for a resource of the given type and returns the inputs that should be passed to successive calls to Diff, Create, or Update for this resource. As a rule, the provider inputs returned by a call to Check should preserve the original representation of the properties as present in the program inputs. Though this rule is not required for correctness, violations thereof can negatively impact the end-user experience, as the provider inputs are using for detecting and rendering diffs.

methods.name: diff
methods.description: Checks what impacts a hypothetical update will have on the resource's properties.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Allocates a new instance of the provided resource and returns its unique ID afterwards. (The input ID must be blank.)  If this call fails, the resource must not have been created (i.e., it is "transactional").

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates an existing resource with new values.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Tears down an existing resource with the given ID. If it fails, the resource is assumed to still exist.

methods.name: read
methods.description: Reads the current live state associated with a resource. Enough state must be include in the inputs to uniquely identify the resource; this is typically just the resource ID, but may also include some properties.
